Apologies if this may count as a necro post, but now that I've started making the next episode of this series, i've realized a problem, which is that In 1.1, Kerbpaint does not work. While I knew this, it means that the color of the mega asteroid is basically bleached, and a white ball floating around is not as visually interesting as the intended colors. Thus I stand at a crossroads: Keep using 1.0.5 for now, deal with the issues of it, and hope kerbapaint updates sometime, or use 1.1, but unfortunately face the problems of no Kerbpaint. (However, only crafts used in future episodes and the asteroid will be affected.)

In other news, I've download texture replacer head packs so I can make my kerbals easier to identify and such, I've finished the dialogue, and I've made any drawings that will be used in the next installment.

That's not an easy question.  Especially from a writing POV.  I totally get where your at, believe me. 

In the short term, if you need to get thru the next couple chapters, you may be best staying with 1.0.5, if it's working OK enough.

But I'm afraid you may be stuck upgrading eventually.  Especially if one of the future updates surprises us with some cool new parts or something.  Or making Asteroid Day completely stock, which is what I'm hoping.  You may end up with no choice in the long run.

If it were me, I would probably use 1.0.5 for now and do some serious thinking and re-writing and damage control, so to speak, and plan on how best to upgrade to 1.1.  Maybe your monster could be split into half a dozen huge class-E's?  IDK... I'm just pulling stuff from thin air, and have no real idea where you want to take this... but I'm sure if you think about it long enough, you can find a way to adjust things but still end up where you wanted to go.

Also remember, all of us here on the forum know how an upgrade can screw up a saved game using mods, and are very, very understanding of the situation.  If you have to fudge things a little, I'm betting everyone will look the other way...  ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ":wink:")
